home.title: Ouroboros
home.subtitle: Charitable foundation
home.description: From the south of Ukraine, we are standing up for one another — using art, mutual aid, and collective care to resist the violence of war and build solidarity from the ground up.

about.title: About Us
about.mainText: We are a grassroots collective based in the south of Ukraine, specifically in Mykolaiv and Kherson, born out of urgency and sustained by care. When the full-scale invasion began, many of us were artists, businesspeople and organizers — but the war pushed us to come together in new ways. We are a multinational team. Our core members come both from the US and from Ukraine.

extendedText.part1: We are a grassroots collective based in the south of Ukraine, specifically in Mykolaiv and Kherson, born out of urgency and sustained by care. When the full-scale invasion began, many of us were artists, businesspeople and organizers — but the war pushed us to come together in new ways. We are a multinational team. Our core members come both from the US and from Ukraine.
extendedText.part2: Oro, one of the founders of the organisation, was a professional photographer, artist and activist in the US before 2022 when he moved to Ukraine. He was drawn here not only by personal sentiment, as several of his close friends had already lived here or volunteered, but also by an innate sense of justice and duty. At first, he volunteered all over Ukraine, documenting war crimes, procuring and delivering humanitarian aid to front-line communities and supporting various military units. He has witnessed firsthand the horrors of russian aggression. He has worked in the east and south with several international organizations and has been living and volunteering in Ukraine for three years now.
extendedText.part3: Lyn, co-founder of the organization, a native Ukrainian and artist, first attended various volunteer initiatives in Lviv. Her desire to do and see more led her to humanitarian actions in the frontline areas in eastern Ukraine, and later to the south after meeting Oro at a friend’s memorial. Lyn is a talented multi-disciplinary artist, and recognizes the healing power of the arts in building community and healing traumas inflicted by war.
extendedText.part4: At the end of 2024, Oro and Lyn founded their organization — the Ouroboros Charitable Foundation. While humanitarian aid remains an important part of their work, the foundation now focuses on long-term needs that are just as urgent: supporting the psychological well-being of people affected by war, maintaining disaster readiness, and providing aid to vulnerable populations.
extendedText.part5: Sadly, every part of Ukraine continues to bear the deep trauma of conflict. Ouroboros has several socially vital projects, such as providing safe shelter and relocation for internally displaced people from high-risk areas of the Kherson region, helping people integrate into new communities, and developing initiatives to revitalize local economies.

project1.title: Humanitarian Aid for Frontline Communities
project1.description:
We work in the south of Ukraine, focusing on frontline and war-affected areas of the Mykolaiv and Kherson regions. Our team delivers essential supplies—food, hygiene items, and medical aid—to vulnerable residents, often under daily shelling. Together with local volunteers, we respond quickly to urgent needs on the ground.
Thanks to strong partnerships with international donors, we receive and distribute humanitarian aid directly where it’s needed most. Our trusted network, built on transparency and local knowledge, allows us to coordinate efficiently across both regions. In our first six months, we reached over 5,000 people—and we continue regular missions to Kherson, where aid remains critically needed.

project2.title: Support for Street Animals and Local Shelters
project2.description:
Conflict doesn’t only affect people—it leaves behind thousands of abandoned animals, too. In frontline areas, especially parts of Kherson and Mykolaiv, the street animal population continues to grow, with many cats and dogs left behind by displaced or deceased owners. Without sterilization or regular care, the situation worsens daily.
We work with local animal welfare volunteers who courageously care for these animals despite the risks and scarce resources. Through our partnerships and donations, we regularly deliver food and basic supplies to help sustain their efforts. We also support two animal shelters—one in the Mykolaiv region and one in Kherson—providing ongoing assistance to keep their operations running safely and humanely.

project3.title: Support and Creation of Local Social & Creative Centers
project3.description:
Healing from war takes more than humanitarian aid—it takes community, creativity, and care. That’s why we support the development and operation of local social and creative centers in frontline towns and villages. With help from our international partners and donors, we provide financial and material support to equip these spaces with everything they need—from basic furnishings to art materials and educational supplies.
These centers offer safe spaces for people to gather, decompress, and reconnect. We organize regular events, workshops, and art-based activities aimed at improving mental well-being, supporting emotional recovery, and encouraging social reintegration—especially for children and families living under the constant weight of war.
By working closely with local organizers and residents, we ensure these centers reflect the needs of the communities they serve, while creating lasting infrastructure for care and resilience.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.mainText: We envision a Ukraine where healing, dignity, and solidarity guide recovery from war.
vision.extendedText: We envision a Ukraine where healing, dignity, and solidarity guide recovery from war. Through community-rooted care, creative expression, and support for displaced people, the Ouroboros Charitable Foundation works toward a future where all survivors of conflict have access to safety, belonging, and the resources they need to rebuild their lives.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.mainText: To create inclusive spaces for healing, empowerment, and regeneration through art, community, and care.
mission.extendedText: To create inclusive spaces for healing, empowerment, and regeneration through art, community, and care. We support war-affected individuals—especially displaced people, youth, and veterans—by fostering creativity, rebuilding communities, and promoting long-term well-being.

project1.title: Creative & Healing Center
project1.description: A safe space for creativity, connection, and recovery. This center will offer art therapy, workshops, and events for youth, displaced people, and war survivors—helping them heal, grow, and rebuild their lives through shared creativity and support.

project2.title: Eco-Settlement for Displaced Families
project2.description: A long-term housing and community project for families displaced by war. By restoring abandoned villages and creating eco-friendly, self-sustaining communities, we aim to provide safety, purpose, and a fresh start in unity with nature.

support.title: Support Our Mission
support.cta: Join us in building safe, healing spaces for those affected by war. Whether through a donation, partnership, or volunteering your time, your contribution truly matters.
support.gratitude: Thank you for standing with us.

volunteer.title: Volunteer
volunteer.description: Contribute your time and talents to help us create safe spaces for healing. Every skill, every hour helps change lives.
volunteer.name: Name

partner.title: Partner
partner.description: Collaborate with us to expand the impact of our mission. Together, we can create safe, healing spaces for those in need.

message.title: Message
message.sponsorship: We’re interested in sponsoring your upcoming initiatives. Let’s discuss how we can contribute.
message.collaboration: We’d love to collaborate on your next project. We believe our missions align closely.
message.other: We have an idea for how we could work together that doesn’t quite fit the other categories.

share.title: Spread the Word
share.description: Help us reach more people—share this page with your network.

partner1.description: Medicines for Ukraine supports both civilian and military hospitals by providing essential medications and medical supplies. Collaborating directly with the Ministry of Health of Ukraine and other trusted partners, the organization also delivers humanitarian aid to civilians. It has been actively operating since the onset of the full-scale invasion.
partner1.name: Medicines for Ukraine
partner1.title: Medical Aid & Humanitarian Relief Organization

partner2.description: AspenAid is a proven agile NGO providing material resources and humanitarian support to Ukraine in its resistance and response to the unprovoked russian invasion.
partner2.name: Aspen Aid
partner2.title: NGO Providing Humanitarian Support for Ukraine

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.description: Whether you have questions, ideas, or simply want to connect—we’d love to hear from you. Reach out and let’s explore how we can build healing, creative spaces together.
